text: Although the innate thirst of vampires cannot be completely eradicated, Jade-Blooded Taoists who deeply study the Wind of Life can significantly restrain their restless desires.
Due to their racial traits, Jade-Blooded Taoists cannot ride living creatures despite their deeper affinity with nature. However, this has granted them supernatural speed.
It is said that "Yingchuo" is an illusion of the Moon Empress. Only when hearing its call can the Black Jade Crowmen channel the Wind of Yin and transform into the mythical bird.
The heroic soul forever recorded in history, forged into an eternal legend through bravery and resilience, inspiring the people of Cathay to charge forward with courage.
The mysterious jade forms this body, guiding the terracotta to channel the Dragon Emperor’s might, circulating and nourishing the lands of the Celestial Empire.
To live as a hero, to die as a legend. Standing proudly between heaven and earth, unyielding in name and unbroken in spirit.

One aspect of the Great Horned Rat’s terrifying visage is the Lord of Catastrophe, a living calamity that brings devastation and desolation from the Chaos Realms filled with destruction and slaughter.

After being expelled from the Dwarven Engineer Guild, Malakai felt deeply humiliated and took the Slayer’s Oath, adopting the garb and demeanor of a Slayer.
The Spirit of Grungni is a thunderbarge created by the Dwarven Butcher Engineer Malakai Makaisson.
Malakai is always willing to lend a helping hand—and a thunderbarge.
Malakai wanted to create a new machine for throwing axes. Hmm? A new machine? That would take too long! It’s easier to train Rangers to throw axes accurately.
Malakai’s latest invention: a handheld multi-barrel gun, unlike the Hellblaster Volley Gun. For now, it’s just a prototype, but mass production might follow.
The sinking of the Unsinkable Ironclad marked the beginning of Malakai’s end. Much can be learned from that tragedy.
The destruction of the airship Indestructible taught us valuable lessons about time management, communication, and proper material handling.
It turns out the Spirit of Grungni's hold can accommodate quite a lot of explosives.
Malakai’s firearm can be upgraded to fire full-size rounds. Rough calculations indicate at least a 65% increase per shot.
This skill is used to manage surplus skill points. It has no effect and can be chosen up to 99 times.

Yingchuo is the Moon Empress' personal gift to Hong Ying, a Taeyue Luan rumored to be the Moon Empress' shadow. Only through hearing its cry can the Onyx Crowmen channel the Wind of Yin and transform into a mythical bird.
A mighty weapon brought from the Moon Empress’s abode, its blade is as clear as the moon, with flowing obsidian-like fire capable of easily breaking the magic of opposing weapons.
Hong Ying possesses an uncanny affinity with the Wind of Shadows. His “staff” is the obsidian flame on his blade, which rises and shifts to channel winds or slay targets when needed.
Legend has it this mask was carved by the Shadow Dragon itself. The wearer can vanish into shadows, move with the wind on the battlefield, and strike generals unseen.
This feather-light cloak symbolizes the master of the Shadow Crow Guard and is the only means, other than Yuanbo, to directly command the Black Jade Crowmen.

The Laurel Pavilion is divided into three guards, and only their masters may hold this token. Hong Ying’s Shadow Crow Guard is tasked with gathering intelligence and carrying out assassinations, their authority akin to the Moon Empress herself.

Since childhood, Hong Ying has been followed by illusions of the divine bird Yu Zhuo. After joining the Laurel Pavilion, Black Jade Crowmen whispered of the vanished power of the Shadow Dragon—a power filled with pain and sacrifice.
The eyes of the Celestial Court pierce all realms; the expanse of their wings covers the skies, guarding the Celestial Empire far and wide.
Born with an affinity for the Wind of Shadows, Hong Ying mastered assassination techniques personally taught by the Moon Empress, striking as shadows and departing like the wind.
Changqi’s disciples believe their schemes flawless as they revel, unaware someone in the adjacent room is diligently sketching their plans…
Swift as the wind and powerful as thunder, he strides through enemy camps with unparalleled bravery.
Night is the best concealment for shadows. The deepest shadow moves alone, waiting for the opportune moment to strike before the enemy realizes their fate.
The master of the Shadow Crow Guard commands the flock, appearing alone while a myriad of crows await in the shadows, ready to swarm at their signal.
Amid the surging tides of espionage, they navigate with ease, leading their subordinates to unravel complex schemes, exemplifying excellence in covert operations.
The outlines of the Celestial Court shimmer faintly in the night, while the moonlit sky is dotted with black feathers, resembling endless gems encrusted in the heavens.
